revision.text:
{{Content bundle}} == Information about this bundle == [[Rationale::This content bundle includes basic elements which are required for the TreeView extension.]] ;Copyright :[[Vendor::ontoprise GmbH]] ;License :[[License::GPL v2]] ;Version :[[Ontology version::144]] ;Requires : *[[Dependency::Smwplus; 156; 156]] ;Installation directory :[[Installation dir::extensions/Treeview]] ;This content bundle is useful if you want to use the TreeView extension. ;How to use it Simply add a call like the following into your article to get a tree view: 
{{#tree:
* node 1
** node 2}}
;Sandbox We have created a small [[Treeview Sandbox|Sandbox of the TreeView extension]] in this Wiki to give you a smooth start. ;User manual More information about the TreeView extension and how to use it can be found in our [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:TreeView_extension TreeView extension help article at SMWForum]. ;This bundle contains these articles : {{#ask:[[Part of bundle::{{FULLPAGENAME}}]] |?=Link |?Rationale |link=subject |default=''none'' |mainlabel=- |source=wiki }} {{Part of bundle|value=Treeview}} {{Content hash|value=a5b59c7c93de4673e7a007ab705bdafa}}
[[Category:Content bundle|Content_bundle]]

= Sandbox for the TreeView extension = ;Building a static tree To obtain a tree which is composed of static elements which never change you use the wikitext syntax for bullet lists (i.e. *). {{#tree:id=test|root=Tree| *This is examplaric content of the tree view **Read here how to adjust it to your needs: [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:TreeView_Extension] *You can adjust the contents of this tree in this article: ** [[MediaWiki:NavTree]] }} The above tree is generated by this wikitext: 
{{#tree:id=statictree|root=Static tree|
*This is examplaric content of the tree view
**Read here how to adjust it to your needs: [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:TreeView_Extension]
*You can adjust the contents of this tree in this article:
** [[MediaWiki:NavTree]]
}}
;Generating a tree from the dynamic data in the Wiki You can instruct the tree view to automatically compose a tree from elements which are interconnected by a relation: {{#tree:id=dynamictree |root=Dynamic tree | {{#generateTree:property=Points to tree element |category=Tree element }} }} The above tree is generated by this wikitext: 
{{#tree:id=dynamictree|root=Dynamic tree|
{{#generateTree:property=Points to tree element
|category=Tree element}}
}}
;Placing the tree in the Wiki You can display trees in wiki articles. Or, if you use Ontoskin3 (the default skin of SMW+), then just copy and paste your tree view-wikitext into this article: 
[[MediaWiki:NavTree]]
Your tree will then open if you click on the arrow at the right hand side of the skin. ;More information can be found here: * [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Example/Semantic_tree_library Library of examples for the TreeView extension] * [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:TreeView_Extension User manual of the TreeView extension] [[Rationale::A small Sandbox of the TreeView extension in this Wiki to give you a smooth start.| ]] {{Part of bundle|value=Treeview}} {{Content hash|value=}}
